runs.comm: begins with a short of a length, with swings away outside of off, as this is fended away towards the off side by the batsman

and Malinga removes Kyle Coetzer with a short of a length which gets the leading edge as he pushed at it half-heartedly, with Malinga claiming this dolly offered up to him in his follow through. Sri Lanka off to the perfect start, and Scotland one down with none on the board
fuller length on middle and off which Machan gets nicely behind the line of
short ball which has Machan weaving out of its path, as Malinga seems to have slipped in a quicker one here
gets away with this hook over towards long leg, with this one falling safely in the end before the fielder could get to in the deep
looking for the attempted slower ball as he ends up dishing a full toss across the batsman which is struck away through third man
length delivery which gets a bit of away movement as it went across Machan
fullish length on middle and leg which is bunted away towards the leg side
length delivery angling through to the slips as Machan cannot be enticed to have a go
nicely behind the line as he pushes at this slightly back of a length delivery through the long on region, beating the dive from the mid-on fielder
content to just shoulder arms to this length delivery going across
looks to force this one away through cover point, but the man at the position is able to get to it in flash
shortish length which is worked away by the batsman behind of square
Malinga attempts the slower yorker, which turns out to be a low full toss and on MacLeod's pads that is clipped away behind square on the on-side for a couple
pushes at this back of a length to get it down towards deep cover, but is pulled back before the rope
attacks again through the point region as the chasing fielders do well to get to it
full and on the stumps as this is eased away through the mid-on region
searches for the blockhole as this one on and around off is dug away to him in his follow through
full delivery angling on the pads as this is worked away to the silly mid-on
strikes him on the pads, but the batsman got an inside-edge, and the angle also suggested this was doing too much anyways
pushes at this length delivery outside of off, but some poor fielding by Prasanna at mid-off allows them through for the run
backs away as he looks to create room to force this back of a length going across him over the covers, but in the end gets away too far from the ball to make any kind of connection
reaches out again to this one slanting across, with third man called into action
length delivery which gets a slight outside edge as third man comes round to collect
fires in a short one which doesn't quite climb as much as it should have, as the batsman does well enough to get out of its way
shortish length which doesn't bounce as much as expected as MacLeod prodded forward to defend
delivers a sharp bouncer which flies over the batsman's head as the umpire signals to the scorers
covers the line of this back of a length on and around middle
pushes at this length delivery shaping away outside off as this flies through the vacant gully region towards third man
length just outside of off which is fended away by Machan to the off side
searching for the yorker as Machan waited on this before steering away through the covers for one
negotiates this length delivery going across him with ease
first, real aggressive stroke from Scotland as Machan sends this slightly back of a length screaming away square off the wicket with a powerful cut
length on middle and leg which is defended back towards the bowler
short of a length and going across as this is worked away off the back foot towards cover
swinging on the pads as this is glanced away through square-leg
length delivery going across which is pushed off the back foot through long off, but is reined in before the boundary
bouncer on middle and off which is avoided by the batsman in the end
has a go with an attempted pull to this shorter one which climbs over him. Signalled one for the over
pitches it up now, straying a bit on middle and leg, as this is bunted away through mid-on
length delivery, shaping away outside of off, as this is struck towards the fielder at mid-off
short ball which MacLeod tries to hook away, but this is far too short as Malinga is penalised by the leg umpire

another length delivery which is sent away, courtesy of an outside edge, through the gully region, and despite shoring it with a wide slip and backward point, still manages to thread the needle to end up at third man
goes round the wicket as he sends in a yorker which is dug out successfully by Machan
length delivery on middle and leg which is handled with aplomb by the batsman
forced away on the off side, but can't penetrate any space
darts in a yorker which has MacLeod playing all around it as he looked to dig away to the leg side. The shape coming in deceived Calum, who is sent back to the pavilion with 11 to his name
fuller length, delivered outside of off, as this is shouldered arms to
half-volley outside of off which is driven on the up through cover point, with this one pulled back just before the rope by Prasanna at the square boundary
punches away this length delivery going across to the fielder at mid-off
begins with a short of a length which climbs appreciably as it was collected by Sangakkara
slips in one on middle and leg which is negotiated safely by the captain
fullish length, outside of off, and the batsman can't be tempted to flirt with it
gets away a drive through the covers that beats the fielder on the ring to reach the deep extra-cover boundary. Just timed away beautifully by Preston
now looks to get past the backward point, but hits it straight to the fielder
flashes at this short of a length which Preston fails to connect. Was close to an outside edge there
worked away on the front foot towards the cover fielder, with the man getting on top of it soon after
comes down the track to try and heave Kula over mid-on, but ends up miscuing it to the fielder, who is able to stop it after it bounced on him
shortish length which the batsman fails to get a hold off as he looked to pull through midwicket
sliding well down the leg side as he looked for the movement inside to the batsman
almost drags on this length delivery snaking in a bit outside off
another inswinging delivery in the same channel which is mishit away towards mid-on
defends this attempted inswinging delivery outside his off stump
length delivery which is driven away on the up through extra-cover, but doesn't quite middle it in the end
some fortune for Machan as he gets away this inside-edge after going for the pull behind of square, with the ball just avoiding the off peg as it went behind
attempts to power this shorter length through midwicket, but is late on the delivery
pulled away through to deep midwicket as Preston is handed the strike
shortish length, slanting on the pads, as Preston utilises the angle to pull this fiercely through square-leg  for four
elects to shoulder arms to this length delivery flying through outside of off stump
begins from round the wicket as this one is fended away towards the leg side

Dilshan fires in a quicker one which looks to have Machan plumb in front as he played all around it. Given out by the umpire straight away, but Machan wants a review after discussing with his partner. No issues with the no-ball. Delivered the arm ball which looks to have struck the front pad, with nothing on Snicko to suggest there was an inside-edge. All about whether it is clipping the stumps, and the verdict is in, with 'umpire's call' being given for this hitting the wicket, so Machan has to go. Big blow to Scotland's chances as he was one of their more established batsmen
continues from round the wicket as this one is defended off the back foot
defended by Coleman with soft hands
blitzed away through to deep extra-cover to get off the strike
sweeps this one drifting across to find the fine leg region
negotiates this first one drifted in on and around off
able to force away a drive square off the wicket to the deep point fielder
jabbed away off the back foot now as Scotland raise their fifty with that single through extra-cover
nicely on the front foot to keep out this one drifting in to him
sees this fractionally short before getting into position to short-arm pull this over the short backward square fielder to the boundary
prods forward before turning this one away behind of square to keep the strike
gets forward to this one sliding in from round the wicket
tries to force away a drive through mid-off, but to no avail

snappy work from behind the stumps by Sangakkara as Preston is late on this push, with the keeper removing the bails when he sees the batsman dragging his foot. Replays confirm that Preston still had his foot grounded when the bails were removed.
played back to the bowler in his follow through
cut away off the back foot towards cover point
tossed up across the batsman as the eventual drive ends up finding mid-off in a hurry
driven away forcefully through to deep extra-cover as Coleman is handed the strike
risky shot as he gets away this paddle through fine leg
now picks up a single on the off side through sweeper cover
struck away towards the fielder at long off in the deep
drifting down the leg side as Coleman is able to tickle this away through fine leg
ends the over with a gentle clip through midwicket
continues from round the wicket as this one ends up back to him in his follow through
glances away the bowler now through the leg side as they scurry through for the run
driven firmly towards long off as he took off the run, which he ends up making safely in the end
rocks forward before nudging this one away through mid-on
advances down the track before playing this back to the bowler
picks a single now through square-leg as the drizzle has started to come down
fails to get away the cut through the off side
now comes down to help himself to a single through long off
onto the front foot to defend this one away softly on the off side
steered down towards long off as he used his feet well to get to the pitch
defended with a nice, high elbow as the ball ends up near cover point
darted in on middle and leg as this is flicked away through midwicket
this one kept low as Preston defended this one away through the leg side
negotiates this one off the back foot
picks up a single as he plays the good ole tap-and-run outside his off stump to perfection
looks for the reverse sweep but is late on the ball, with Sanga collecting it
rocks forward to keep out this Dilshan special on middle stump
advances down to work this one away down to long on to end the over
eases away a run through long off
drives this one away firmly to the man at deep extra-cover
able to tuck this one away just behind of square on the leg side
darted in outside off as Preston comes down the track before heaving this over the space at cow corner for a boundary
sliding on middle and leg as this goes off the front pad, with Sangakkara coming round to catch this, but there was no contact with bat or glove
slaps away a single down to deep extra-cover
short and well outside off as this dabbed straight to the fielder at short third man
content to just negotiate this one away softly on the leg side
able to get a single with a push down to long off
comes down the track before lofting Dilshan gracefully over deep extra-cover to get this over the rope after a couple of bounces
defended back to the bowler in his follow through
gets forward to play at this one with soft hands before setting off for the other end to complete the run
shortish length, outside of off, which is run down through the third man region
short of a length and fended away by the batsman on the leg side
punched away off the back foot to locate the man at deep extra-cover
cut away towards the fielder at point, who is able to pounce on the ball, but can't prevent the single from being taken in the end as he fumbled the ball away on the first try
pulls this short ball, but hits it a bit too straight to the long on fielder
digs out this fuller length haring on the off stump

sends in a fierce yorker on middle and leg which the batsman was well late on, probably out of surprise, as he sent this down at a fair clip. Easily the fastest of all the bowlers on show today in just that one delivery
full outside of off as this is drilled towards point
induces the outside edge, but the batsman is able to edge this past the slips to find a boundary through third man
full delivery which strikes the batsman just above the left shoe as Chameera went up for the shout, but the angle suggested this was definitely going down leg
Coleman responds to the previous delivery with a wonderful straight drive to this pitched up deliver on and around middle
back of a length and cut away just behind of square as Malinga, who looked ungainly as he came round from third man, is unable to stop this from going over, despite putting in a dive
whips away a single onto the leg side to get off the strike
gets away this fuller one with a sliced drive to third man
length delivery which is bunted away on the off side by the Scottish captain
covers the line of this one angling in from outside off on a length
shortish length which is fended away on the off side
slaps away this back of a length to the man at sweeper cover
another one which is allowed to go through third man. They should look at putting in a fielder there as a number of strokes have fallen through that area
succeeds in getting an outside edge that lands just in front of Mahela to his right as he tried to get his hand on it. Ends up flying away to the third man rope
length outside of off which is worked over to the covers, before some sloppy fielding from both sides of the wicket allows them to get two more
looks to clatter this short of a length square off the wicket, but is late on it
on the back foot as this one is bunted away towards the cover region
dispatches this short delivery over midwicket to find the boundary
length delivery on and around off which is respected by the batsman
width given outside of off as he hit this aerially over to deep extra-cover
shortish length outside of off which is played away to the cover region
tries to ease away a run now through long on, but can't pinch the single
fuller length, on the pads, which Coleman clips away expertly through the vacant cow corner region to move to 49
and he gets to his fifty with a push to the off side. Receives generous applause from the Hobart crowd for his effort
able to get away a single to this short of a length outside of off, working this one away close to him on the leg side
is late on this attempted flick through the on side, but doesn't stop them from running the leg bye
nurdles away a single on the back foot to deep backward square
attacks this back of a length, but picks out the man at backward point
full and angling in on off as Mommsen drives hard, but picks out the mid-on fielder
in the slot as Preston is able to drill this one on the up through extra-cover
short delivery which Coleman tries in vain to ramp over to the third man region
chips this length delivery outside his off stump, but has to reach for it, with this one going over, but landing safely in the end in the deep
fuller delivery which is steered down towards mid-on
length delivery which is pushed away to the covers before he barreled down to the other end. There was a shy at the stumps at the striker's, but the dive from Coleman had him in
directs away this short delivery through midwicket
pitched up and driven down to mid-on to end the over
dropped Kusal makes a complete hash of this mis-timed slice over the covers from the batsman. Really was a straightforward chance, but just burst through in the end
not at all affected by the previous ball as he goes after this short, wide delivery angling away. Called wide by the umpire
Preston now earns a life as he flat-bats one over long off, with this one evading the fielders chasing from the ring
another lofted, mistimed pull which lands in no-mans land, this time around mid-on. Scotland getting some good fortune here so far
eases away a single through the covers to rotate the strike
pitched up and driven firmly by the batsman to the long on fielder
fends away this back of a length on the off side
given plenty of air as this one is driven away to the mid-off fielder
another flighted ball which this time is worked away to the backward point
darted in on the pads as this is defended back to him
advances down to drive this one past the bowler to long off
fails to get away a single through the covers as Dlishan fields the ball in the area
steers this one down to long off as there doesn't seem to be any urgency on the part of SL to attack for wickets. Also brings up the pair's 100-run stand
fires in a length outside of off which Preston is late on

steers away a single off the back foot through backward point. Preston gets to his fifty as well as a result. Has really been some serene batting from the two, apart from the odd risk which has not come off for Sri Lanka
like this one, as Coleman sends over a mistimed pull to midwicket, but there are no fielders in the vicinity
sends away this back of a length outside off with a powerful slap, finding the sweeper cover in a hurry
short of a length as Coleman fails to get this one away square off the wicket
comes down the track to try and send Chameera back over his head, but the ball ends up flying through to the keeper
drives this one away outside of off to the man at cover
comes down the track before easing this one away to long off
able to get away this reverse sweep to this delivery bowled on the full, but picks out the short third man
goes for the heave over midwicket, with this one reined in before the boundary
tossed up just outside off, and spinning away, as this is helped away to extra-cover
backs away before drilling this to the man in the deep at extra-cover to end the over
length delivery outside off which is run down to third man
slower delivery from Perera, but it was well outside the line. Called a wide by the umpire
length delivery around off, Mommsen leans forward, opens the face of the bat and pushes it to backward point
great shot from the Scottish captain. It was short and sat up nicely for Mommsen to swivel and pull behind square, with the ball rocketing to the fence
very poor ball from Perera. Another slower one and this one is even further away from the line
angling in on middle, Mommsen waits for it and clips it towards midwicket to get off strike
length delivery just outside off, Coleman was pushing at it from the crease, gets an outside edge that runs away down to third man

and finally, after what seems like ages, the stand is broken as Mommsen drives this fuller length delivery on the up straight to the short cover fielder, who is able to take the catch comfortably as he dove forward
steers away a single down to deep extra-cover to get off the strike
drives this one away to the covers, but is held by the close-in fielder
pierces through Dilshan's attempt at collecting this at short cover, with a full-blooded drive which races away to the extra-cover boundary
now flights a delivery on middle and leg which is swept away powerfully over the square-leg boundary for a six
defended with a slightly angled face onto the off side
works one away down to towards the deep on the off side
gets forward before finding the single in the gap at cover point
fuller one, outside of off, which is drilled to the man at mid-off
short of a length which is negotiated safely by Coleman off the back foot
steps over the off side to try and reach out to this slower, full delivery, but is still unable to get to it despite the extra effort
fails to get this away this length delivery outside off past point
finds the gap behind of square on the leg side as this long hop down the leg side is punished with an effective pull shot
drifting one down the leg side as this is helped away behind of square
flighted outside of off as this is drilled straight to the extra-cover fielder
steers this next one down to the fellow at long off
driven down to the fielder at long on, but can't get it past him
Prasanna has been poor today as he lobs up one which is slog-swept through cow corner for a six. Bowled this one flat so he could get under it effectively
slipping down the leg side as this is swept round the corner to bring drinks on the field
begins with a length delivery which the batsman plays just inside of the line of
short of a length and fended away behind of square by the batsman
looking to pick the space past long on, but hits it straighter than he would have liked to the fielder
gets far too early into this attempted short-arm pull as this slower ball almost clips the off stump
fails to get away this improvised scoop over fine leg, as he shimmied over a great deal to the off side to play this back-of-the-hand slower ball

Coleman has to go after looking for the heave over long on, ends up getting a toe-end to this slower ball which goes up straight over mid-on, with Perera settling under it nicely. Departs the oval, but has played a valuable knock all the same
deceives the batsman with this loopy, full length slower ball. Would have bowled him had this been on target
fires in a yorker which was sliding on the pads as Leask fails to get this away
low, full toss slower ball which is tickled away with the angle through fine leg
tries a quicker ball, albeit a full toss, which is fended away by the batsman safely
length delivery on and around middle which is defended away by the batsman
fires in a traditional yorker which is dug out safely in the end by Berrington
fuller delivery, angling in on middle and off, as Leask gets a slight inside-edge onto the pads
dabs down a run through third man to get off the strike
wide yorker which he is able to reach to, but ends up lasering this away through point, with cover point flying to his left to intervene
sends in a bouncer which Leask is late on as he had a flash

looks to send this shorter ball high over midwicket, but is unable to get to it. Looked like it might be called a wide, before Sangakkara, thinking the batsman may have got a bat on it, asked for a review. Doesn't appear to be any indication of bat on ball on first glance, but Snicko has something a bit more definitive, as there appears to be a flicker on the line when the ball passed through, hitting somewhere around the bottom edge of the bat. After some deliberation, the decision has come in, and he has been given out. Excellent review by Sangakkara, as he seemed to be the only one confident about this
greeted to the crease with a yorker down to mid-off, before some sloppy work by the fielder allowed him through to get the single to get off the mark
full delivery on and around off which is defended by the batsan
negotiates this Malinga special on and around off
defended away to the off side, but can't pinch a single
searching for the blockhole as he lets loose a low full toss which is struck away to the mid-on fielder
slower ball which is slogged over towards midwicket, but luckily falls away from the fielder
manages to get away this low, full toss through backward square, completing a brace in the process
forces the batsman on the back foot with this shortish length which he looked to pull through midwicket

extremely fortunate for Cross as he is surprised by the pace of this short of a length, hanging his bat as the ball went off the face to fly over Sangakkara towards the boundary, but is pulled back before the rope
follows the batsman, who was backing away to create room on the off side, with a yorker which finds its mark, as Cross dug it away on the on side

Cross' little Hobart adventure comes to a close as he looks to flat-bat this one over the bowler, with this flying just to the right and back of the keeper at third man, who is able to get his gloves around it as it swirled in the air
unleashes an above-waist full toss which is carted away through fine leg, but only just. Replays show this was more around the thigh, so a bit unlucky for him as he got penalised
works away this back of a length on the leg side
able to get away this fuller delivery on and around off with a scythe through long off which beats the chasing fielder from mid-off to the boundary
slips in a yorker right on the money which is dug away by the batsman to the off side
firing down the leg side now as somehow Sri Lanka get away with this potential wide. Probably had to do with Taylor following it by backing towards the delivery
now tests him with a slow, short bouncer which has Taylor throwing his hands through the shot far too early
another mistimed lofted stroke somehow evades a fielder as this length delivery is sent over long on, but away from any prying hands

completely miscues this back of a length as he hit this aerially over mid-on. Was another slower ball which caught the toe-end as Perera is given another opportunity at catching practice. Scotland eight down now as Sri Lanka look to deliver the final rites
able to pick up a single square off the wicket to retain the strike
Chameera sends in a fuller length which is clubbed away, although not well enough, to the fellow at mid-off, who almost fumbles it as it went through the hands before he could consolidate the catch
tries him out with a short ball outside of off which he is not tempted to engage with
searching for the blockhole as Evans does well to dig this one out on the off side
length delivery on middle and leg which is fended away on the leg side
runs away this short of a length outside of off to third man

back of a length delivery on the pads, Davey hops up in the crease and tucks it away towards midwicket. There was a slight hesitation as the batsmen went in for the single, but the batsman makes it in time at the non-striker's end as the fielder had a shy at the stumps
loopy full toss down leg as Davey moves slightly across but fails to tickle it fine
full and outside off as Davey leans forward and knocks it onto the off side
slower length delivery just outside off. Davey goes for the loft over cover, but doesn't get hold of it properly as this falls away in the deep
slower full toss that was dipping in on the leg stump. Davey backs away and just about gets his bat down in time to push it back towards the bowler
able to nurdle a single through midwicket now
slow full toss which just falls short of the fielder stationed wide of mid-on, as this one fell inside of the ring
and Sri Lanka wrap it up here in Hobart, courtesy of this edge off Chameera's bowling which flies comfortably to Lahiru at first slip, who is able to get low to his left to pluck it
